children.subject: I think your ESS advisor would be able to answer this much more clearly than any of us.

history.content:
Hello, I'm an ME major interested in picking up an EECS Minor (with a focus on the EE side) and have been looking through the policies/course listings.

Would taking EE 194-002: Hands on Ham Radio count as one of the three upper-division courses for the EECS minor? I saw that the policy here only states that "EE or CS 195, H196, 197, 198, or 199" are the ones that can't be taken, but since EE 194 is a special topics course and is only 1-unit, I wasn't sure if this still counts as a technical course.


Also, do all CS 194 courses count for the EECS minor? I saw that the CS minor is more restrictive and only allows certain ones, but I didn't see anything about 194 classes for the EECS minor in particular.

My apologies if this question has already been answered somewhere else- I couldn't find it here. Thanks!!
history.subject: Choosing 3 Upper-Division Courses for EECS Minor
